When the Pinot node starts up, it connects to Zookeeper and creates an Ephemeral node. Helix watches for the creation of this Znode and starts issuing the transitions

This tool is doing the following
1. Download the segment, 
2. <do something>
3. upload the segment again.
Conceptually this is very similar to what a Pinot Minion does.

It will be great if we can model this as an ad-hoc or standalone Minion tool. I haven't looked into the interface of a Task in minion but if we can use the same interface to implement this task of adding date time column then we can leverage this tool to run any minion task.

@Jackie-Jiang @npawar what do you think?

@kishoreg As discussed offline, there are currently multiple constraints to model this as a minion task and run it via a tool that runs adhoc minion tasks. The task executor uses minionContext which is created using cluster configs on startup. We will need to duplicate minion setup steps to make this work. There's also some configs needed by pinotTaskConfigs which we will have to manually construct.
As a result, keeping it independent of the minion as a separate tool seems like the best option right now.
